title: Slaviša Dugić
text:
Slaviša Dugić (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic">Serbian Cyrillic</a>: Славиша Дугић; born 17 January 1985) is a <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a> professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player of <a href="Bosnian%20Serb">Bosnian Serb</a> descent.
Background.
He had played for Swiss teams <a href="SC%20Kriens">SC Kriens</a>, <a href="FC%20Servette">FC Servette</a>, <a href="FC%20Aarau">FC Aarau</a>, Italian <a href="Catania%20Calcio">Catania Calcio</a>, <a href="Yverdon-Sport%20FC">Yverdon-Sport FC</a>, <a href="FC%20Wohlen">FC Wohlen</a>, <a href="SC%20Buochs">SC Buochs</a>, Bosnian <a href="FK%20Modri%C4%8Da">FK Modriča</a> and <a href="Aris%20Limassol%20F.C.">Aris Limassol F.C.</a>, <a href="Ethnikos%20Achna%20FC">Ethnikos Achna FC</a> and <a href="Othellos%20Athienou%20F.C.">Othellos Athienou F.C.</a> from Cyprus. He is a former youth international and was in the <a href="Switzerland%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Swiss U-17</a> <a href="2002%20UEFA%20European%20Under-17%20Football%20Championship%20squads%23.C2.A0Switzerland">squad</a> that won the <a href="2002%20UEFA%20European%20Under-17%20Football%20Championship">2002 U-17 European Championships</a>.
